intro: Aeschynomene acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco sesban, is a flowering plant species native to Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments. Aeschynomene acapulcensis is also noted for its potential use in ecological restoration due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
